description: The CodeBoarding system orchestrates a comprehensive code analysis and documentation generation workflow. It begins with the Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager initializing projects, managing code repositories, and detecting changes. This orchestrator leverages the Incremental Analysis Engine to optimize performance by caching and re-analyzing only modified code. The core intelligence resides in the LLM Agent Core, which uses large language models to interpret code and analysis results. The agent interacts with the codebase and static analysis data through the Agent Tooling Interface, which in turn queries the Static Code Analyzer for deep structural and behavioral insights. Finally, the LLM Agent's findings are passed to the Documentation & Diagram Generator to produce user-friendly documentation and visual architectural diagrams.

components.name: Application Orchestrator & Repository Manager
components.description: Manages the overall application lifecycle, including project initialization, repository operations (cloning, updating), change detection, and orchestrating the analysis workflow. It also handles the initial setup and environment configuration for the analysis tools.

components.name: Application Orchestrator
components.description: The central brain of the system. It handles CLI entry points, validates the environment (API keys, paths), and coordinates the execution flow between full scans and incremental updates.

components.name: Repository State Manager
components.description: Manages the physical lifecycle of the target codebase. It handles cloning, branch switching, and generates unique state hashes to ensure analysis reproducibility.

components.name: Incremental Change Detector
components.description: Optimizes performance by identifying what has changed since the last run. It compares git commit hashes and file-level diffs to determine the minimal set of files requiring re-analysis.

components.name: Tool Environment Registry
components.description: Acts as a package manager for the analysis engine. It discovers, installs, and resolves paths for external binaries like LSP servers (Python/TypeScript) and Tokei across different OS platforms.

components.name: Scope & Exclusion Manager
components.description: Defines the "effective analysis area" by parsing `.codeboardingignore` files. It filters out noise such as build artifacts, node_modules, and test suites.

components.name: Job Persistence Manager
components.description: The system's memory. It uses DuckDB to store job metadata, execution status, and links repository versions to specific analysis results for historical tracking.

components.name: Analysis Aggregator
components.description: A transformation layer that takes raw output from various static analysis tools and maps them into a `UnifiedAnalysisJson` model, preparing the data for LLM consumption.

components.name: Observability Engine
components.description: Monitors the health and costs of the pipeline. It tracks LLM token usage, tool execution latency, and provides telemetry for the agentic workflows.

components_relations.relation: triggers environment setup and binary verification
requests a specific repository state (clone/checkout) to begin the pipeline
provides the current and previous commit hashes to calculate the analysis delta
passes raw file changes to be filtered against exclusion rules
sends raw tool outputs to be synthesized into the final unified model
updates job status and saves metadata upon pipeline completion
wraps execution steps to capture latency and token usage metrics

components.name: LLM Agent Core
components.description: The intelligent core responsible for driving the code analysis and documentation generation using large language models. It orchestrates agent workflows, manages interactions with various tools, and structures the analysis insights.

components.name: Agent Orchestrator
components.description: Central controller (CodeBoardingAgent) that manages the analysis lifecycle, maintains shared state, and sequences agent execution.

components.name: Context & Strategy Engine
components.description: Combines metadata extraction (MetaAgent) and recursive planning (PlannerAgent) to determine analysis scope and priorities.

components.name: Architectural Synthesizer
components.description: AbstractionAgent responsible for grouping files and clusters into high‑level logical components based on CFG patterns.

components.name: Functional Analyzer
components.description: DetailsAgent that performs deep‑dives into specific subgraphs to extract implementation details and class/function relationships.

components.name: Structural Verifier
components.description: ValidationEngine that cross‑references LLM insights against raw CFG data to ensure architectural claims match the actual call graph.

components.name: Prompt Management System
components.description: PromptRegistry that provides model‑specific templates (Claude, GPT, Gemini) to ensure consistent LLM interactions.

components.name: Provider Configuration
components.description: Manages LLM initialization, provider‑specific settings (Ollama, Bedrock, etc.), and system‑wide constants.

components.name: Analysis Data Schema
components.description: Pydantic ResponseModels (e.g., AnalysisInsights) used for type‑safe communication between agents.

components_relations.relation: initiates analysis by requesting project grounding and a prioritized inspection plan
supplies project‑level bias and metadata for grouping clusters into logical components
passes high‑level mental model to guide deep‑dive analysis of specific implementation details
submits extracted implementation insights for validation against the ground‑truth CFG
returns validated, high‑fidelity insights to be integrated into the final repository documentation
retrieves specialized prompt templates tailored to the specific LLM provider being used
requests configured LLM client instances with appropriate temperature and token limits
utilizes structured Pydantic models to format implementation details for downstream consumption

components.name: Static Code Analyzer
components.description: Performs deep structural and behavioral analysis of the codebase across multiple programming languages. It extracts information like call graphs, code structure, and identifies code quality issues, including unused code.

components.name: Static Analysis Façade
components.description: Primary entry point; coordinates discovery, extraction, and modeling phases while persisting unified metadata.

components.name: Discovery & Environment Manager
components.description: Scans the repository to identify project structures (Maven/Gradle) and filters files based on Git changes.

components.name: LSP Orchestration Engine
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of language servers; handles JSON‑RPC communication and aggregates raw symbol diagnostics.

components.name: Semantic Reference Resolver
components.description: Resolves ambiguous symbols and links call sites to definitions across module boundaries to create a unified symbol map.

components.name: Architectural Modeling Engine
components.description: Constructs the global CallGraph and applies community detection (Louvain/Leiden) for high‑level module discovery.

components.name: Static Quality Check Suite
components.description: Implements structural analysis routines to detect "God Classes," unused code, and topological imbalances.

components.name: Health & Quality Orchestrator
components.description: Drives the diagnostic pipeline; configures and executes specific health checks based on the architectural model.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Manager
components.description: Manages stateful analysis by comparing current repository deltas with cached results to minimize redundant processing.

components_relations.relation: Requests a filtered list of files and environment parameters to define the analysis scope.
Provides configuration metadata and file paths required to bootstrap language‑specific servers.
Streams raw symbol data and location references for cross‑file linking.
Supplies resolved symbol edges to populate the structural CallGraph.
Provides the complete graph topology for executing depth‑first searches and metric calculations.
Forwards detected quality issues and unused code findings to be standardized into health reports.
Queries for previous analysis states to determine which modules require re‑processing.
Uses Git diff data to invalidate specific cache entries in the state store.

components.name: Agent Tooling Interface
components.description: Provides a set of specialized tools that allow the LLM Agent Core to interact with the codebase, query static analysis results, and perform specific actions within the project context.

components.name: Toolkit Registry
components.description: Acts as the central factory and lifecycle manager for the subsystem; it discovers available tools and provides a unified get_all_tools interface for external agent orchestration.

components.name: Repository Context Manager
components.description: Provides the foundational state and shared logic for all tools, including filesystem pathing, ignore‑file management, and result caching.

components.name: Static Analysis Provider
components.description: Interfaces with the static analysis engine to extract high‑level architectural data, including Control Flow Graphs (CFGs), class hierarchies, and method invocation chains.

components.name: Source Content Retriever
components.description: Performs granular retrieval of raw code and documentation; it can read entire files or extract specific code blocks based on fully‑qualified identifiers.

components.name: Project Topology Mapper
components.description: Maps the physical and logical layout of the project, generating directory trees and identifying package‑level relationships and imports.

components.name: Change Context Provider
components.description: Wraps Git operations to provide incremental change data, allowing agents to focus their analysis on modified code sections rather than the entire codebase.

components.name: Dependency Analyzer
components.description: Scans and parses project manifests (e.g., pyproject.toml) to identify external libraries and the broader ecosystem the project relies on.

components_relations.relation: Injects the shared RepoContext into every tool instance during initialization.
Triggers the retriever to fetch specific code blocks identified during structural analysis for deeper inspection.
Utilizes the centralized directory walking and ignore‑file utilities to generate accurate project maps.
Retrieves the validated repository root path to execute localized Git commands.
Inherits base filesystem utilities to ensure consistent file access and adherence to project‑specific ignore rules.
Manages the instantiation and registration of tools that transform raw static analysis data into agent‑consumable formats.

components.name: Incremental Analysis Engine
components.description: Optimizes analysis performance by managing the caching of static analysis results and orchestrating re-analysis only for changed parts of the codebase, ensuring efficiency and speed.

components.name: Incremental Update Orchestrator
components.description: The central controller that coordinates the sequence of operations from change detection to final validation. It manages the high‑level workflow, ensuring that impact analysis, patching, and re‑analysis occur in the correct order.

components.name: Analysis Cache Manager
components.description: Manages the lifecycle of serialized artifacts (call graphs, hierarchies) and validates their integrity for reuse. It acts as the primary data provider for components that need historical analysis state.

components.name: Structural Impact Analyzer
components.description: Evaluates code changes to identify "dirty" sub‑graphs and determines if changes cross architectural boundaries, necessitating broader re‑analysis.

components.name: Cluster Change Analyzer
components.description: Classifies the magnitude of architectural shifts (Small/Medium/Big) by comparing current and historical clustering data to detect significant drift.

components.name: Scoped Re‑expansion Engine
components.description: Orchestrates LLM‑based agents to perform deep re‑analysis specifically on sub‑graphs flagged as dirty, ensuring AI interpretation stays in sync with code changes.

components.name: File & Path Patching Manager
components.description: Handles in‑place updates to the analysis manifest, such as file renames and component re‑assignments, without requiring a full re‑parse of the repository.

components.name: Analysis I/O Manager
components.description: Provides thread‑safe, locked access to the analysis store (DuckDB and file system) to ensure data consistency during concurrent incremental updates.

components.name: Update Integrity Validator
components.description: Performs final consistency checks between the updated analysis state and the physical file system to ensure no orphaned nodes or broken references remain.

components.name: Documentation & Diagram Generator
components.description: Transforms the processed analysis data and insights into user-friendly documentation formats (e.g., Markdown, HTML) and generates visual representations like architectural diagrams.

components.name: CLI & Orchestration Engine
components.description: Serves as the primary interface and control center for the tool. It handles command-line argument parsing, environment variable validation, and orchestrates the entire workflow, from initiating repository processing to triggering analysis and output generation.

components.name: Analysis Core Engine
components.description: Executes static code analysis, builds file coverage data, and generates detailed analysis results. It interprets code structure, relationships, and handles incremental updates to the analysis data.

components.name: Analysis Data Store/Manifest Management
components.description: Manages the persistent state and metadata of the analysis. It stores the manifest and file coverage information, providing mechanisms for loading, saving, and updating these critical analysis results.

components.name: Output Generation & Formatting
components.description: Transforms the processed analysis data into various user‑friendly documentation formats (HTML, Markdown, MDX, reStructuredText). This component integrates templating capabilities to ensure consistent styling and structure across all generated outputs, encapsulating all format‑specific generators and the common templating engine.

components.name: GitHub Action Integration
components.description: Provides specific entry points and orchestration logic tailored for execution within GitHub Actions CI/CD pipelines. It handles loading existing analyses and triggering documentation generation within an automated workflow context.

Orchestrator initiates analysis workflow, leveraging incremental updates based on detected code changes.
Orchestrator passes project context and triggers the main analysis workflow for the LLM Agent.
Incremental engine requests static analysis for specific code segments (new or changed).
Static analyzer provides analysis results to the incremental engine for caching.
LLM Agent invokes specialized tools to interact with the codebase and analysis data.
Agent tools query the static analysis engine for detailed code insights.
Static analysis engine provides requested data to the agent tools.
LLM Agent delivers structured analysis insights for documentation and diagram generation.
